help.short: The name of the Firewall Policy.
Expands referenced resources. Default value is None.

json.schema:
<prop readOnly="True" type="array<@SubResource_read>" name="childPolicies">
<prop type="array" name="servers">
<prop readOnly="True" type="array<@SubResource_read>" name="firewalls">
<prop type="array" name="workspaces">
<prop type="array" name="bypassTrafficSettings">
<prop type="array" name="destinationAddresses">
<prop type="array" name="destinationIpGroups">
<prop type="array" name="destinationPorts">
<prop type="array" name="sourceAddresses">
<prop type="array" name="sourceIpGroups">
<prop type="array" name="privateRanges">
<prop type="array" name="signatureOverrides">
<prop readOnly="True" type="array" name="ruleCollectionGroups">
<prop type="array" name="privateRanges">
<prop type="array" name="fqdns">
<prop type="array" name="ipAddresses">

help.short: The name of the Firewall Policy.

command.name: create

help.short: The name of the Firewall Policy.

argGroup.arg: <help short="Location. Values from: `az account list-locations`. You can configure the default location using `az configure --defaults location=`."/>

help.short: The name or ID of parent firewall policy from which rules are inherited.
SKU of Firewall policy.
A flag to indicate if SQL Redirect traffic filtering is enabled.
The operation mode for Threat Intelligence.
Space-separated tags: key[=value] [key[=value] ...]. Use "" to clear existing tags.
FQDNs in Network Rules are supported when set to true.

The type of identity used for the resource. The type 'SystemAssigned, UserAssigned' includes both an implicitly created identity and a set of user assigned identities. The type 'None' will remove any identities from the virtual machine.

The list of user identities associated with resource. The user identity dictionary key references will be ARM resource ids in the form: '/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/Microsoft.ManagedIdentity/userAssignedIdentities/{identityName}'.

command.argGroup:
<arg type="array" var="$parameters.properties.intrusionDetection.configuration.bypassTrafficSettings" options="bypass-traffic-settings">
<arg type="array" var="$parameters.properties.intrusionDetection.configuration.bypassTrafficSettings[].destinationAddresses" options="destination-addresses">
<arg type="array" var="$parameters.properties.intrusionDetection.configuration.bypassTrafficSettings[].destinationIpGroups" options="destination-ip-groups">
<arg type="array" var="$parameters.properties.intrusionDetection.configuration.bypassTrafficSettings[].destinationPorts" options="destination-ports">
<arg type="array" var="$parameters.properties.intrusionDetection.configuration.bypassTrafficSettings[].sourceAddresses" options="source-addresses">
<arg type="array" var="$parameters.properties.intrusionDetection.configuration.bypassTrafficSettings[].sourceIpGroups" options="source-ip-groups">
<arg type="array" var="$parameters.properties.intrusionDetection.configuration.privateRanges" options="private-ranges">
<arg type="array" var="$parameters.properties.intrusionDetection.configuration.signatureOverrides" options="signature-overrides">

help.short: IDPS mode.
Resource ID.
Explicit Proxy Settings definition.
When set to true, explicit proxy mode is enabled.
When set to true, pac file port and url needs to be provided.
Port number for explicit proxy http protocol, cannot be greater than 64000.
Port number for explicit proxy https protocol, cannot be greater than 64000.
SAS URL for PAC file.
Port number for firewall to serve PAC file.
Insights on Firewall Policy.
A flag to indicate if the insights are enabled on the policy.
Number of days the insights should be enabled on the policy.
Secret Id of (base-64 encoded unencrypted pfx) Secret or Certificate object stored in KeyVault.
Name of the CA certificate.

command.argGroup:
<arg type="array" var="$parameters.properties.threatIntelWhitelist.fqdns" options="fqdns" group="Threat Intel Allowlist">
<arg type="array" var="$parameters.properties.threatIntelWhitelist.ipAddresses" options="ip-addresses" group="Threat Intel Allowlist">

json.schema:
<prop type="array" name="servers" arg="$parameters.properties.dnsSettings.servers">
<prop type="array" name="workspaces" arg="$parameters.properties.insights.logAnalyticsResources.workspaces">

<prop type="array" name="privateRanges" arg="$parameters.properties.intrusionDetection.configuration.privateRanges">
<prop type="array" name="signatureOverrides" arg="$parameters.properties.intrusionDetection.configuration.signatureOverrides">
<prop type="array" name="privateRanges" arg="$parameters.properties.snat.privateRanges">
<prop type="array" name="fqdns" arg="$parameters.properties.threatIntelWhitelist.fqdns">
<prop type="array" name="ipAddresses" arg="$parameters.properties.threatIntelWhitelist.ipAddresses">
